授業方法:
This course is currently planned for face-to-face format. Meetings via Zoom will be held as needed. Weekly meetings mostly consist of mini lectures, reading-based discussions, individual and group presentations, Junior Thesis writing workshops, and peer and instructor feedback sessions.

(Information for students permitted to take classes online)
For the majority of lessons, data recorded from face-to-face-classes will be broadcast on-demand. Links to the recorded lessons will be provided by the instructor. When necessary, some face-to-face lessons will be held simultaneously on Zoom. Students permitted to take classes online are expected to watch on-demand lectures, join live Zoom classes when offered, and complete the required assessments according to the course schedule.

トピック.授業外学習2:
Student preparation outside of class meetings includes:
(1) Weekly preparation assignments, including carefully reading English academic journal articles and completing preparation tasks,
(2) Conducting literature research on seminar and Junior Thesis topics,
(3) Preparation for leading and participating in discussions,
(4) Preparation for individual and group presentations, and
(5) Writing, using peer and instructor feedback, and revising Junior Thesis drafts.

There is typically an overseas seminar fieldwork trip in early February. This year, the possibility of such a trip will depend on the status of COVID-19 and university guidance. If there is fieldwork trip, participation will be optional.

成績評価Grading0: 評価基準等　Grading Criteria etc.
成績評価Grading1: Attendance, active participation, thorough completion of reading assignments and preparation for seminar meetings, leading discussions, giving presentations, completing Junior Thesis assignments, submitting the complete Junior Thesis that meets the stated requirements by the January deadline
